thread.title: Moeen Ali keen to build on promising start as England Test opener
thread.title_full: Moeen Ali keen to build on promising start as England Test opener

title: Moeen Ali keen to build on promising start as England Test opener
text:
Moeen Ali keen to build on promising start as England Test opener 20 Oct 2015 11:46:53 
comments 
Moeen Ali is hoping to build on his encouraging start, in two crucial roles for England on their Test tour against Pakistan. 
In his maiden attempt as a Test opener, Moeen helped Alastair Cook post a stand of 116 in the drawn first match in Abu Dhabi. 
Then he put a wicketless first innings behind him to take two in quick succession, as Pakistan were bowled out for 173 on the final day to give England a chance of an unlikely victory. 
The all-rounder was also able to help his fellow spinner Adil Rashid stay on an even keel, and hit back on his debut with five for 64 after also having no success first time round. 
The match situation dictated that the often adventurous Moeen, promoted up the order for the first time after being down at number eight during the Ashes last summer, had to bat against type. 
He said: "I was just doing a job for the team and trying to give us a good start. 
"There was scoreboard pressure, but I really enjoyed it and I felt I could play properly again. I felt like a batter." 
He has his eyes on a permanent spot as Cook's opening partner, but knows he will need to make even more substantial contributions consistently. 
"I've got to score some runs before I can think of doing it for years," he added. 
"I just want to keep giving England a good start - which is really important here." 
As for Rashid's rollercoaster debut, Moeen reported it was not too difficult to keep the leg-spinner positive - despite his first-innings none for 163. 
"He took a bit of stick in the first innings. 
"But we felt he bowled well, and there was nothing in it for him. 
"We kept telling him his wickets would come. 
"I didn't really have a chat with him. We just went out for some food, like we do, and talked about how we were going to bowl in the second innings." 
After Cook's brilliant 263, and Rashid's improvement, only bad light stopped England going 1-0 up. 
They have another opportunity to do so in the second match of three, in Dubai, starting on Thursday. Related Sport News
